Package de.oth.blocklib.disasters.meteors

Class MeteorShower

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.disasters.Disaster
de.oth.blocklib.disasters.ChunkAllocatingDisaster
de.oth.blocklib.disasters.meteors.MeteorShower
public class MeteorShower
extends ChunkAllocatingDisaster
The MeteorShower Disaster. A ChunkAllocatingDisaster that causes a multiple Meteors to hit the earth.
Author:
Tobias Mueller

  • Constructor Details

    • MeteorShower

      public MeteorShower​(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f impactPoint, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f travelDirection)
      Creates a new MeteorShower. Should be added to a DisasterManager, so it gets automatically updated.
      Parameters:
      impactPoint - the point where the Meteors should roughly crash onto the ground.
      travelDirection - the direction in which the Meteors should be coming from.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Description copied from class: ChunkAllocatingDisaster
      Overrides the Disaster's start method, so that it is used for requesting all Chunks that are contained in the physicalArea from the ChunkStorage.
      Overrides:
      start in class ChunkAllocatingDisaster

    • update

      public void update​(float deltaTime)
      Description copied from class: Disaster
      Method that can be overwritten to include functionality that should be called once in every frame of the BlockLib.
      Specified by:
      update in class Disaster
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - the time that has passed since the last update.

      public void onAllocationFinished()
      Description copied from class: ChunkAllocatingDisaster
